name: American Idol
overview: Each year, hopeful singers from all over the country audition to be part of one of the biggest shows in American television history. Who will become the new American Idol?

episodes.name: Auditions
episodes.overview: A humorous debut for this hit reality show series. It showed three judges, which were Randy,Paula, and Simon, getting starting to search for the next American Idol. They went to different cities, in each one picking 30 to move on to the next round.Faced with some that were great preformers, or the most talentless people you've ever seen. In the end thouh, successfully they found over a 100 people for the next round.

episodes.name: Hollywood Week
episodes.overview: After going through their first round, things start to heat up when the competion gets harder. Now the contestants have to learn routines, and sing/dance in groups of threes and fours. The judges will pick which ones in the group stay. They had to learn these routines in a couple of nights, sacrificing their resting time. There was no time to relax, they had to stay focused. Many were stressed, and forgot their lines, and didn't know what to do. This narrows the search down to fewer people.

episodes.name: No Way Jim Moves On After That Performance. Right, Simon? Simon?
episodes.overview: They sing.  You vote.  You decide.  Brian Dunkleman and Ryan Seacrest host as group one performs for America.  The fate of the 10 hopefuls rests in America's hands as only the Top 3 contestants move on.  Performing tonight are Tamyra Gray, Jim Verraros, Adriel Herrera, Rodesia Eaves, Natalie Burge, Brad Estrin, Ryan Starr, Justinn Waddell, Kelli Glover, and Christopher Aaron.

episodes.name: Dewey Defeats Truman!
episodes.overview: The show is live and the votes are in!  America will see which 3 contestants they voted for will move on to the final 10.

episodes.name: Wild!
episodes.overview: 10,000 auditioned... 121 made it to Hollywood... 30 sang for your vote and 9 are through to the next round.  Tonight 5 Wild Cards return to sing again for the judges to decide LIVE which one will complete the Final 10.  Tonight on American Idol, who will it be?

episodes.name: Let's learn about Ruben and Clay!
episodes.overview: This episode contained interviews with the judges, and Clay & Ruben, plus audience questions. A look back at how it all started was included and at the very end. Then it's time for a coin flip. Ruben calls heads, it comes up tails and Clay elects to go second. Ruben chooses to go with the wind and defend the south end zone. Coming up next, the opening kickoff!

episodes.name: Clay v. Ruben
episodes.overview: The final three battle it out to get America's vote for a trip to the Finale and a chance to become the next American Idol.

episodes.name: I Bet It'll Be Ruben! Or Clay!
episodes.overview: The Top 3 become the Top 2, but who is in the finale and who has sung for the last time? Find out live.

episodes.name: First Show, First Recap
episodes.overview: In The Beginning of the Journey on AI3, we start out in New York city, where contestants start to compete...most fail, but 29 make it to the next round!

episodes.name: The Journey Continues!
episodes.overview: The auditions continue as the judges move on to Atlanta. And just when they think it couldnt get any worse, well.....it does

episodes.name: Night Three!
episodes.overview: Embarassment in Houston.  Only 13 people out of the thousands that auditioned made it.  Wow...

episodes.name: Finally! A Show About California!
episodes.overview: Once again, hopefuls compete in Los Angeles and San Francisco to be the next American Idol.  Not much else to say...the talent was not there.

episodes.name: Mokolokilikilanilaki! It's Hawai'i!
episodes.overview: The contestants are now in Hawaii, battling it out for the trip to Hollywood.  People from all over the country come to Hawaii to see if they've got it, but for most people, it turns out they don't.

episodes.name: The Road is to Hollywood! (Is Paved with Broken Dreams. And Asphalt.)
episodes.overview: Today's show is about the lost contestants that auditioned, but we never got to see...some pretty bad ones, i'm glad that we didn't see them at first...Ouch!

episodes.name: You're Going to Hollywood! (For a Little Bit, At Least.)
episodes.overview: Now it's time for those 117 finalists to show their stuff, but not literally.  After some bad lyrics to made up songs, MANY MANY MANY forgotten lyrics, and goofiness, the finalists are trimmed down to 87, as the search for the American Idol 2004 begins!

episodes.name: 87 - People Not Good Enough = 32 Finalists!
episodes.overview: One again, the margin of finalists is getting smaller, now narrowed down from 87 to 32.  After many forgotten words (again) by both the guys and girls groups, the top 32 doesn't look all that impressive...or does it?

episodes.name: Top 11 Finalists Re-Vote
episodes.overview:
AMERICAN IDOL's Top 11 finalists return for a special live episode to allow for voting to take place again. (A graphics glitch in Tuesday's show may have caused confusion in the voting process.) The 11 contestants' performances will be repeated during this LIVE hour. Voting will take place for two hours following the end of the telecast in each time zone. Only these voting results, not Tuesday's, will determine who will survive another week in the competition and who will go home. Tune in to see who impresses the judges and who buckles under the pressure on Wednesday, March 23

After the break, we find Lisa to be safe while kevin and Bucky stand anxiously on stage...Eventually, we had to say goodbye to chicken little (kevin)...

well atleast he can say that this show has really changed his life

episodes.name: Idol Gives Back
episodes.overview:
Tonight American Idol partners with Charity Projects Entertainment Fund to raise awareness and money for young people living in extreme poverty in America and Africa. The Top 6 finalists will perform for the nation, singing songs related to compassion and hope during a “Life Anthems”-themed episode. And your vote counts more than ever before, on this special night, you can help change the lives of the truly needy as the American Idol sponsors, Coca-Cola and AT&T/Cingular, along with additional partners, will donate money for every vote you cast.

Tonight's Theme is: Life Anthems

episodes.name: Idol Gives Back
episodes.overview: Idol Gives Back is a music celebration raising awareness and benefiting various U.S. and international charities. This year's event will be bigger and more ambitious than ever, and will feature incredible international artists and sports stars including Bono, Brad Pitt, Reese Witherspoon, Miley Cyrus, Mariah Carey, Eli Manning, Peyton Manning, Fergie, Chris Daughtry, Carrie Underwood, Annie Lennox, John Legend, Snoop Dogg, Fantasia Barrino, Elliott Yamin, Robin Williams, Celine Dion, Forest Whitaker, Billy Crystal, Dane Cook, Kiefer Sutherland, Vanessa Hudgens, Ashley Tisdale, Band From TV (Hugh Laurie), Jennifer Connolly, and Amy Adams, John Cena, Triple H, Chris Jericho.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round 1
episodes.overview: With the auditions out of the way, now is the time to separate the good from the bad and to find the real talent that holds in the rooms. With the individuals hoping to make a name for themselves, who is going to outshine the rest and make it through to the next round?

episodes.name: Hollywood Round 2
episodes.overview: It is Group Week and no one is safe for this round of tough auditions. With many already to go, a twist forces them to separate and form new groups and make new friends. Which group is going to make it through to the next round and which are going home? The judges decide.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round 3
episodes.overview: Now it is the individuals to show what they have and to shine out the rest of the competition and to show the judges that they did not make the wrong choice from choosing from the Group Week. This week they are solo with the help of the band or their own instrument.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round 4

episodes.overview: American Idol's newest judge, Ellen DeGeneres, joins Simon Cowell, Kara DioGuardi and Randy Jackson in Hollywood to begin winnowing down the contestants. The golden ticket contenders chosen from around the nation will endure a grueling rehearsal schedule and pressure-packed auditions as they vie for a coveted spot among the Top 24. Find out who will survive and who will go home during round 1.

episodes.name: Auditions No. 1: New York/New Jersey
episodes.overview: The talent contest opens Season 10 with auditions in New York and New Jersey.

episodes.name: Auditions No. 2: New Orleans
episodes.overview: As the old saying goes, be careful what you wish for. After many viewers (yours truly included) complained that American Idol's Season 10 premiere on Wednesday didn't offer anything remarkably different from past seasons, Thursday's episode gave us something we've never seen before: Randy Jackson's bare stomach. I'm pretty sure that's not what any of us were hoping for. So, what had Randy (and Steven!) taking off their clothes? And which New Orleans singers gave J. Lo goose bumps and moved her to tears? Let's find out....

episodes.name: Auditions No. 3: Milwaukee
episodes.overview: The American Idol audition train rolled on to Milwaukee, which served up yet another batch of really young youngsters, a few more impressive standouts and the most ridiculous auditions we've seen thus far. But while watching and judging the wannabes, some interesting things happened to the judging panel: Steven Tyler became an even more inappropriate softie, Jennifer Lopez finally looked comfortable crushing people's dreams and Randy Jackson ... actually said something smart?  So which singers inspired these changes?

episodes.name: Auditions No. 4: Nashville
episodes.overview: The auditions continue from Nashville, TN on the new season of American Idol as the judges continue their quest to find the next singing superstar.

episodes.name: Auditions No. 5: Austin
episodes.overview: Before American Idol got down to wild and wacky business in Austin, the producers decided to start the show with a somber moment. Responding to some recent outrage over Steven Tyler's outlandish (and sometimes vulgar) outbursts and his inappropriate come-ons toward some of the younger female singers, the producers apologized for his "outrageous behavior." So did the Aerosmith rocker straighten up?

episodes.name: Auditions No. 6: Los Angeles
episodes.overview: Well, the other shoe finally dropped. After a season that, so far, has mostly favored  the good auditions, Thursday's episode focused almost exclusively on the bad. Steven Tyler attributed the change to the city of Los Angeles, which he deduced is full of delusional people. Things got so bad that even J. Lo discovered her potty mouth. So, who was the worst of the worst?

episodes.name: Auditions No. 7: San Francisco, CA
episodes.overview: The auditions continue from San Francisco, CA on the new season of American Idol as the judges continue their quest to find the next singing superstar.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round: Part 1
episodes.overview: With the auditions out of the way, now is the time to separate the good from the bad and to find the real talent that holds in the rooms. With the individuals hoping to make a name for themselves, who is going to outshine the rest and make it through to the next round?

episodes.name: Hollywood Round, Part 2
episodes.overview: It is Group Week and no one is safe for this round of tough auditions. With many already to go, a twist forces them to separate and form new groups and make new friends. Which group is going to make it through to the next round and which are going home? The judges decide.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round, Part 3
episodes.overview: Now it is the individuals to show what they have and to shine out the rest of the competition and to show the judges that they did not make the wrong choice from choosing from the Group Week. This week they are solo with the help of the band or their own instrument.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round, Part 4
episodes.overview: The 61 contestants are going to have to sing the Beatles to show that they have what it takes to handle the pressure of the competition. A lot happens in the 2 hour show. A contestant gets married, hearts are broken and one judge doesn't know if it is possible to continue to tell people the bad news that they didn't make it through. Some of the Top 24 are revealed.

episodes.name: Top 24 Chosen
episodes.overview: The eliminations continue to reveal the Top 24 contestants for the American Idol Live Shows. With a lot riding on this and after Jennifer's big blow up, will she been able to go on? The contestants await their fate.

episodes.name: Top 12 Boys Perform
episodes.overview: The Top 12 Boys perform. Clint Jun Gamboa, Jovany Barreto, Jordan Dorsey, Tim Halperin, Brett Loewenstern, James Durbin, Robbie Rosen, Scott McCreery, Stefano Langone, Paul McDonald, Jacob Lusk, and Casey Abrams take to the stage to show that they have what it takes to be the next American Idol. Who will outshine the rest and who will fall short?

episodes.name: Top 12 Girls Perform
episodes.overview: The Top 12 Girls perform and Naima Adedapo, Lauren Alaina, Kendra Chantelle, Ashthon Jones, Thia Megia, Haley Reinhart, Karen Rodriguez, Pia Toscano, Lauren Turner, TaTynisa Wilson, Rachel Zevita, and Julie Zorrilla each perform at their best to show that they have what it takes to make it to the next stage in the competition. Is there the next American Idol in this bunch?

episodes.name: Finalists Chosen
episodes.overview: The results are in and the Top 24 are going to be cut down to 13 tonight. This is the most cut at this point in the competition and all hopefuls are nervous. Who has made the cut to be part of America's Top 10 and the 3 Wildcard spots? Jennifer Lopez's new music video is also premiered.

episodes.name: Auditions No. 1: Savannah
episodes.overview: Television's No. 1 series returns for its highly anticipated 11th season with brand new contestants, a superstar judging panel and the best and worst of auditions. Host Ryan Seacrest and judges Randy Jackson, Jennifer Lopez and Steven Tyler traveled across the country to Charleston & Savannah where the good, the bad and the outrageous auditioned for their shot at stardom. This season promises to deliver the most talented group of singers yet and as always, it's up to the viewers to root and vote for their favorite contestants, ultimately crowning the next American Idol.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round, Part 1
episodes.overview: The contestants who impressed the judges in their respective audition cities will head to Hollywood, where some dreams will come true and others will come to an end. The intensity of the competition heats up as hopefuls chosen from around the nation vie for a coveted semifinalist spot.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round, Part 2
episodes.overview: The tough Hollywood Round continues, as judges Mariah Carey, Randy Jackson, Nicki Minaj and Keith Urban narrow down the contestants. Some will leave with shattered dreams, others will move on in the competition.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round, Part 3
episodes.overview: The ultimate singing stage test resumes in Hollywood as the contestants vie for a coveted spot in the semifinals.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round, Part 4
episodes.overview: In the final Hollywood episode, the judges reveal the Top 40 contestants - 20 guys and 20 girls - who remain in the competition. These contestants will travel to Las Vegas in hopes of impressing the judges one more time. See which contestants shine and which ones crack under the pressure.

episodes.name: Denver & Atlanta Auditions
episodes.overview: Host Ryan Seacrest and judges Jennifer Lopez, Keith Urban and Harry Connick Jr. begin their search for talented vocalists with auditions in Denver and Atlanta.

episodes.name: Little Rock & San Francisco Auditions
episodes.overview: The search for the most talented vocalists continues with auditions in Little Rock, Ark., and San Francisco.

episodes.name: Philadelphia Auditions
episodes.overview: Ryan and the judges continue their search for talent with auditions in Philadelphia.

episodes.name: Denver & Little Rock Auditions

episodes.name: Hollywood Round #1
episodes.overview: The judges have heard auditions from all over the country, and now it's time for the best of the best to see if they are cut out for Hollywood.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round #2
episodes.overview: The contestants press on to show the judges what they've got as Hollywood Week continues.

episodes.name: Hollywood Round #3
episodes.overview: Hollywood week continues and the contestants are put to the test. Who will come out on top?

episodes.name: Hollywood Round #4
episodes.overview: The contestants have survived Hollywood week and it is time to find out who will continue on in the competition. Only the best of the best will make it through as the Top 24 are revealed.

episodes.name: Showcase #1: 1st 12 Performances
episodes.overview: The Top 24 have been chosen, and now it's time for the contestants to show the judges that they are here to stay. Twelve of the Top 24 perform in hopes of earning their spot.

episodes.name: Showcase #2: Judges Vote
episodes.overview: Favorite former Idols will return to mentor and sing with the contestants. Then, after giving it their all, the first round of performers will find out who will make the cut. The judges vote on who will stay in the competition to become the next, and final, American Idol.

episodes.name: Showcase #3: 2nd 12 Performances
episodes.overview: The remaining 12 of the Top 24 get their chance to shine as they perform for the judges' votes.

episodes.name: Showcase #4: Judges Vote
episodes.overview: Idol fan favorites return to mentor and perform, as the judges vote on the second showcase and five contestants are sent home. Find out who advances to the Top 14 in the quest to become the final Idol.

episodes.name: Wildcard Night: Judges Pick
episodes.overview: After proving themselves alongside Idol legends, some semifinalists will reach the end of their journey. The judges will announce the first eight semi-finalists to make it into the Top 10, leaving six to sing for America's vote and the final two spots in this farewell season's Top 10.

episodes.name: Top 10 Revealed and Perform
episodes.overview: The first live show of the season is finally here! Host Ryan Seacrest will reveal America's Vote and announce the final two semi-finalists joining the Top 10. Then, the Top 10 finalists will perform for America's vote.

episodes.name: Top 6 Perform
episodes.overview: As the competition moves forward, Idol hopefuls have limited time to make a name for themselves. Find out who will move on and who has reached the end of the road.
